## CRITIC OUTPUT FORMAT (required)

For each issue found:
### <critic type>-N: <title>
- **Severity**: high|medium|low
- **Description**: <explanation>

Severity rubric:
- HIGH = blocks implementation or causes incorrect behavior
- MEDIUM = degrades functionality or creates ambiguity
- LOW = minor issue or style

If no issues found:
### NO ISSUES FOUND

Do NOT invent issues. Only report genuine gaps.

critics.name: Proposal
critics.evaluate: `proposal.md` internal consistency: "what" not "how" with no implementation detail, clear "Why", explicit "What Changes", "Capabilities" address goals, "Impact" is about users not tech

critics.name: Design
critics.evaluate: `design.md` internal consistency: thorough architecture, non-conflicting technical decisions that reinforce architecture, specificity doesn't constrain coding, goals with context, non-goals with rationale

critics.name: Functional
critics.evaluate: `design.md` implements all proposal capabilities and "What Changes"

critics.name: Technical
critics.evaluate: `design.md` verifies that decisions requiring non-obvious, novel, or complex implementation document how they are technically feasible and testable

critics.name: Dependency
critics.evaluate: Hunt for unjustified, undocumented, poorly documented, or unviable (inactive, obscure, expensive, complex) external dependencies (commands, packages, applications, services) in `design.md` and ensure each complex solution approach is explicitly justified over viable (simpler, stable, active, well known) external dependency alternatives

critics.name: Requirement
critics.evaluate: `specs/*/spec.md` files follow Gherkin behavior test writing practices, each requirement (REQ-<abbreviated capability>-X) and scenario (SCN-<abbreviated capability>-X.Y) has a unique ID, tests suitable for E2E/integration tests (NEVER unit tests)

critics.name: Validation
critics.evaluate: Each capability in `proposal.md` has a corresponding spec file with slug directory name; specs cover all implied interface behaviors in `proposal.md`

critics.name: Verification
critics.evaluate: Specs cover all design interfaces; each scenario testable with defined E2E/integration tooling

critics.name: Design for Test
critics.evaluate: `design.md` defines tooling/methods for spec verification; infrastructure covers each type of E2E/integration test

critics.name: Logic
critics.evaluate: Design behaviors correctly implement spec requirements

critics.name: Test
critics.evaluate: Tasks implement E2E/integration test spec scenarios
